page.title: 13THREE CROSSES VILLAGE
page.content: Like Dunvant and Killay,Three Crosses or Crwys,to give it its Welsh name,has become a dormitory area for people working in Swansea and districts near- by,the only employment in or near the village being on five small farms and in three shops. Although there are two public houses, the village lacks amenities for young people as is evident by the number who congregate on the village green in the evenings.The new Community Centre is too small to cater for large groups although the Young Farmers' Club,the Women's Institute and a Mother and Toddler Group make use of its facilities. Use is made of the School Hall for meetings of Brownies and Guides and a Kung Fu Club.It is also the venue for a monthly disco for local youth.
